title: How to Cook Onion for Curries in a Pressure Cooker

steps.headline: Freeze a 2-3 pound bag of onions for 15 minutes.
steps.description: This will allow the juices of the onions to get cold and ensure that the process of dicing them is easy on the eyes.

steps.headline: Dice them roughly.
steps.description: They do not have to be perfect or finely diced. A rough chop is fine. Place them in a pressure cooker.

steps.headline: Cook the onions on medium heat.
steps.description: Once the pressure has been reached, cook the onions for 15 minutes. Each pressure cooker is different. Some have a continuous sound while others have a whistle go off every few seconds. Once you hear the sound, you start the time from there. But do read the user manual for your pressure cooker to get the best instructions.

steps.headline: Remove the onions from heat and let the pressure come down naturally.
steps.description: This means you let the pot cool down so you can open the lid (always be careful when opening a pressure cooker—again read the user manual).

steps.headline: Hand blend or place the onions in a blender until they are smooth.
steps.description: They should almost resemble applesauce in color and texture.

steps.headline: Place the pureed onions in an ice cube tray and freeze it.
Pop out the onion cubes and place them in a Ziploc bag in the freezer.
steps.description: Now you have sautéed onions ready to use when needed.

steps.headline: Use the onion cubes.
steps.description: To make curries, just add a small amount of oil to a pot on low-medium heat and add 3-4 cubes (depending on amount of curry you are making). Let the onion cubes melt slowly and then add the remaining ingredients. The onions are fully cooked so you don't need to cook them much further. Use the cubes for other dishes that call for onion flavor. This can include other stews, chiles, and soups.

Dice them roughly. They do not have to be perfect or finely diced. A rough chop is fine. Place them in a pressure cooker. Cook the onions on medium heat. Once the pressure has been reached, cook the onions for 15 minutes. Each pressure cooker is different. Some have a continuous sound while others have a whistle go off every few seconds. Once you hear the sound, you start the time from there. But do read the user manual for your pressure cooker to get the best instructions. Remove the onions from heat and let the pressure come down naturally. This means you let the pot cool down so you can open the lid (always be careful when opening a pressure cooker—again read the user manual). Hand blend or place the onions in a blender until they are smooth. They should almost resemble applesauce in color and texture. Place the pureed onions in an ice cube tray and freeze it.  Pop out the onion cubes and place them in a Ziploc bag in the freezer. Now you have sautéed onions ready to use when needed. Use the onion cubes. To make curries, just add a small amount of oil to a pot on low-medium heat and add 3-4 cubes (depending on amount of curry you are making). Let the onion cubes melt slowly and then add the remaining ingredients. The onions are fully cooked so you don't need to cook them much further. Use the cubes for other dishes that call for onion flavor. This can include other stews, chiles, and soups.
